page.title: 04Flora of Aston Clinton
page.content: In the southern part of our area we have at least two square kilometres of woodland consisting of a mixture of deciduous and coniferous trees. The Norway Spruce is the main coniferous tree,it has many uses including paper pulp, ladders sides and rafters. Larch is used for railway sleepers and fencing. The beech is the main deciduous tree. It is a large strong tree growing up to 30 metres tall. In Aston Clinton there are a lot of trees and plant life. At Green Park there are some wild flowers which you can see along the nature trail. Behind the Sports Complex some young horse chestnut saplings are growing. As you go down the entrance to the Complex there are Wellingtonias, with red spongy bark. As you walk down the various roads you see many flowers.
